intro: Mascagnia mesoamericana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It has hairy stems and elliptical leaves, and its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects. Mascagnia mesoamericana is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
